contents.item: Nine out of ten significant people have to do with money or war!
contents.owner: Jonathan Safran Foer, Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close

contents.item: You think money can solve any problem, but all it s good for is buying the things it can, and leaving you free to pursue the things it can't.
contents.owner: Ann Herendeen, Phyllida and the Brotherhood of Philander

contents.item: I have no taste for either poverty or honest labor, so writing is the only recourse left for me.
contents.owner: Hunter S. Thompson, The Proud Highway: Saga of a Desperate Southern Gentleman, 1955-1967

contents.item: God, how impossible life is without money. Nothing can ever overcome it, it's everything when it's anything. How can I write in peace with endless worries of money, money, money? (“Disappearing Act”)
Religion is what keeps the poor from murdering the rich.
The really essential factors of success in any undertaking are money and opportunity, and as a rule, the man who can make the first can make the second.
Dont struggle for salary.. DO struggle for Success..
Because I keep it real and reality is a ruthless bitch. Plus I wanna make money – you cool with that?” - Gable
Let attitude be Your determination, go for success and not for money, because success is money
A girl should set her sights on a man who has money; or if not, who can expect to come into money; or if not, who has moneyed connections.
Time is a waste of money.
contents.owner: Oscar Wilde, Complete Works of Oscar Wilde

contents.item: Money and time are the heaviest burdens of life . . . the unhappiest of all mortals are those who have more of either than they know how to use.
Money is far commoner than time. When one reflects, one perceives that money is just about the commonest thing there is.
contents.owner: Arnold Bennett, How to Live on 24 Hours a Day

contents.item: It's amazing. The moment you show cash, everyone knows your language.

There is no end in India, Mr. Jiabao,as Mr. Ashok so correctly used to say. You'll have to keep paying and paying the fuckers. But I complain about the police the way the rich complain; not the way the poor complain. The difference is everything.
The only thing I like about rich people is their money.
As I’m fond of saying, if you want to find utopia, take a sharp right on money and a sharp left on sex and it’s straight ahead.
Like so many women for whom money has always been provided without their understanding how, she was prepared to be a thorough and irresponsible plunger.
There is no money in poetry, but then there is no poetry in money.

Nothing feels dirtier than living a life that is not your own. No amount of money is worth my soul. I would rather be homeless and go out in a blaze of glory than subject myself to a slow and steady death of apathy and government by my environment.
contents.owner: Chris Matakas, The Tao of Jiu Jitsu
